comments.body: Does this mean the race exists in a real cluster too?

It's more like the uncertainty in testing. Our volume binder will try to dynamically provision if no static matching PV is found. But in some test cases, we expect the volume binder to use the static PV, so we need to wait for the PV to be available. 

I think it's fine in real clusters. In theory, it's possible that some newly created PVs may not be synced to the scheduler or not be in the available state when a PVC is created to request a PV from the storage class. But, normally both the static provisioning and dynamic provisioning are acceptable for users if a storage class supports both of them.
this takes the attempts from 45 seconds to 15, assuming 3 retries are needed?
Is it still worth waiting for the PVs to be marked available before creating the PVCs in TestVolumeBinding?
10 seconds, assuming 1st conflict occurs at time 0. test timeout is 30 seconds. I could check for PVs to be available too, which would take the worse-case wait down to 5 seconds
added one more commit to wait for PVs to be available
